Detailed Description

NAME

WeBWorK::DB::Record - common functionality for Record classes.

CONSTRUCTOR

  • new($Prototype)

    Create a new record object, set initial values from the record object $Prototype, which must be a subclass of WeBWorK::DB::Record.

  • new(%fields)

    Create a new record object, set initial values from the hash %fields, which must contain keys equal to the field names of the record class.

BASE METHODS

  • idsToString

    Returns a string representation of the object's keyfields.

Returns a string representation of the object's fields.

Returns a hash representation of the object's fields. If interpreted as a list, the fields will be in order.

Returns an array representation of the object's fields.

private method WeBWorK::DB::Record::_fields (  ) 

Undocumented Method

# Number of lines of code in _fields: 34
sub _fields {
    my $invocant = shift;
    my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
    my @field_data = @_;
    
    my %field_data = @field_data;
    my @field_order = @field_data[ grep {$_%2==0} 0..$#field_data ];
    my @keyfields = grep { $field_data{$_}{key} } @field_order;
    my @nonkeyfields = grep { not $field_data{$_}{key} } @field_order;
    my @sql_types = map { $field_data{$_}{type} } @field_order;
    
    no strict 'refs';
    
    # class methods that return field info
    *{$class."::FIELD_DATA"} = sub { return \%field_data };
    *{$class."::FIELDS"} = sub { return @field_order };
    *{$class."::KEYFIELDS"} = sub { return @keyfields };
    *{$class."::NONKEYFIELDS"} = sub { return @nonkeyfields };
    *{$class."::SQL_TYPES"} = sub { return @sql_types };
    
    # accessor functions
    foreach my $field (@field_order) {
        # always define a "base" accessor
        # custom public accessors can use this to actually do the getting and setting
        *{$class."::_base_$field"} = sub {
            my $self = shift;
            $self->{$field} = shift if @_;
            return $self->{$field};
        };
        # if there isn't a public accessor in the subclass, alias it to the base accessor
        next if exists ${$class."::"}{$field};
        *{$class."::$field"} = *{$class."::_base_$field"};
    }
}

# Number of lines of code in _initial_records: 8
sub _initial_records {
    my $invocant = shift;
    my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
    my @initializers = @_;
    
    no strict 'refs';
    *{$class."::INITIAL_RECORDS"} = sub { return @initializers };
}
public method WeBWorK::DB::Record::idsToString (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in idsToString: 4
sub idsToString {
    my $self = shift;
    return join " ", map { "$_=" . (defined $self->$_ ? "'".$self->$_."'" : "undef") } $self->KEYFIELDS;
}
public method WeBWorK::DB::Record::init_from_arrayref (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in init_from_arrayref: 4
sub init_from_arrayref {
    my ($self, $prototype) = @_;
    @$self{$self->FIELDS} = @$prototype;
}
public method WeBWorK::DB::Record::init_from_hashref (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in init_from_hashref: 4
sub init_from_hashref {
    my ($self, $prototype) = @_;
    @$self{$self->FIELDS} = @$prototype{$self->FIELDS};
}

sub init_from_object { shift->init_from_hashref(shift) }
public method WeBWorK::DB::Record::new (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in new: 18
sub new {
    my $invocant = shift;
    my $self = bless {}, ref($invocant) || $invocant;
    
    if (@_) {
        if (UNIVERSAL::isa($_[0], __PACKAGE__)) {
            $self->init_from_object($_[0]);
        } elsif (ref $_[0] eq "HASH") {
            $self->init_from_hashref($_[0]);
        } elsif (ref $_[0] eq "ARRAY") {
            $self->init_from_arrayref($_[0]);
        } else {
            $self->init_from_hashref({@_});
        }
    }
    
    return $self;
}

Reimplemented from WeBWorK::DB.

# Number of lines of code in toArray: 4
sub toArray {
    my $self = shift;
    return map { $self->$_ } $self->FIELDS;
}

# Number of lines of code in toHash: 4
sub toHash {
    my $self = shift;
    return map { $_ => $self->$_ } $self->FIELDS;
}
